name: Product Documentation
description: Product specifications, release notes, and technical documentation

documents.title: Release Notes v3.0
documents.content:
Release Notes - Version 3.0

New Features:
- Advanced analytics dashboard with custom widgets
- Real-time collaboration on documents
- API v2 with GraphQL support
- SSO integration with SAML 2.0 and OIDC
- Automated workflow builder

Improvements:
- 40% faster page load times
- Redesigned navigation sidebar
- Enhanced search with filters and facets
- Mobile-responsive admin panel

Bug Fixes:
- Fixed CSV export timeout for large datasets
- Resolved permission inheritance issue in nested folders
- Fixed notification delivery delays

documents.title: API Reference Guide
documents.content:
API Reference Guide

Base URL: https://api.example.com/v2

Authentication:
All API requests require a Bearer token in the Authorization header.

Endpoints:

GET /users - List all users
POST /users - Create a new user
GET /users/:id - Get user details
PATCH /users/:id - Update user
DELETE /users/:id - Delete user

GET /documents - List documents
POST /documents - Create document
GET /documents/:id - Get document
PUT /documents/:id/content - Update document content

Rate Limits:
- Standard: 100 requests/minute
- Enterprise: 1000 requests/minute

name: Company Wiki
description: Internal company processes, team information, and policies

documents.title: New Employee Onboarding Guide
documents.content:
New Employee Onboarding Guide

Week 1: Getting Started
- Set up your laptop and accounts (IT will provide credentials)
- Complete compliance training modules
- Meet your team and manager
- Review company handbook

Week 2: Deep Dive
- Shadow team members on key workflows
- Set up development environment (if engineering)
- Complete product training
- First 1:1 with manager

Week 3-4: Ramp Up
- Take on first small task/project
- Attend team planning meetings
- Set 30-60-90 day goals with manager

Key Contacts:
- IT Support: it-support@company.com
- HR: hr@company.com
- Facilities: facilities@company.com

documents.title: Engineering Standards and Best Practices
documents.content:
Engineering Standards and Best Practices

Code Review Process:
- All changes require at least one approval
- Use conventional commits format
- PRs should be under 400 lines when possible
- Include tests for new features

Deployment:
- Staging deploys happen automatically on merge to main
- Production deploys require manual approval
- Rollback procedure: revert the PR and merge

Tech Stack:
- Frontend: React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS
- Backend: Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis
- Infrastructure: AWS, Terraform, GitHub Actions

On-Call:
- Rotation is weekly, Monday to Monday
- Primary on-call responds within 15 minutes
- Escalation path: Primary → Secondary → Engineering Manager
